oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 16 a.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 16 a. Newspaper clipping: Mass Meeting! Market Hall, Friday Night. July 18th, 1924. Called by L. Graham Crozier, Bureau of Political Information.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: L. Graham Crozier
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mass Meeting! Citizens of Knoxville and County Market Hall, Friday Night July 18th, 1924, 7:30 O'Clock Called by L. GRAHAM CROZIER Bureau of Political Information. Subjects to be discussed: Reduction of large salaries and more equal distribution among smaller paid employes (sic.). Lower assessment and lower tax rate on the home. Larger and better market conditions. Suggest a Legislative Ticket that will enable us to secure these things for our People. Good Stirring Music, by the Band: The Famous So. Knoxville Quartet will render Favorite Selections If you are interested in lifting the burden from the taxpayer. If you want our low paid employes (sic.) to receive a DECENT WAGE Come to the Market Hall Friday night and help inaugurate the fight. Don't Forget The Time and Place Market Hall Friday Night
